page.title: 05Folk Customs In Otley.
page.content: Otley's oldest building is the old Buttercross.This building has been standing since medieval times.It is now used as a place for selling items for charity. The oldest Agricultural Show in England is the Otley Show which has been held since 1796 every May. Every Easter a large wooden cross is placed on top of the Chevin. The Market which has been coming to Otley for 900 years still comes on Fridays and Saturdays.The Market still stands next to the Buttercross selling cheap items. The Maypole which used to stand on the Cross Green opposite the Civic Centre does no longer exist as the Cross Green was recently made into a car park. By Vicky Robinson & Clare Roberts.
